original: Oscar Viktor Emanuel, stadskamrer, kapten, Växjö, f. 1/12/97 i Örebro av grossh. J. A. Pehrson o. Augusta Johansson. G. 25 m. Astrid Ruckman. — Ex. v. Örebro hand:-gyimn. 17, DS I 23. Kapt. i Kronob. reg. res. Stadskamr :assist. i Örebro 19-24, komm:kamr. i Borlänge 24-30, stadskamr. i Enköp. 30-3’8, i Växjö fr. 38. Suppl. f. ordf. i Enköp. systembol. 35-38, ordf. i Växjö bef :utb :fören. fr. 40, v. ordf. i Kronob. bef :utb :förb. verkst. utsk. fr. 44, led. av hemv. förvind fr. 40, av länsstyr. förordn. led. av hemv :kretsnd, led. av Kronob. L lluftsk:förb. styr. CFBSM, Kronob. Ist SM, VOR ftjt, Kronob. bfb GM. , Thore Gustaf Brynolf, id. postdirektör, Göteborg, f. 9/11/81 i Leksand, Kopparb. 1., av postm. Brynolf W. o. Lydia Lindahl. G. 05 m. Gärda Almqvist. Barn: Herman f. 06, Bernt 10. — Postex. 99, mog:ex. CO, jur. prel:ex. s. å., hovriex. 02. Förste postexp. 09, not. 13, överpostkontr. 14, sekr. h. gen :poststyr. 15, postdir. o. chef f. västra postdistr. sed. 17. Avd:-sekr. h. riksd. rev. 07-12, h. riksd. be-villn :utsk. 09-12, led. av postclieck-komm. 18-20 m. fl. postala konim., anlitad f. uppdr. inom civ:- o. fin :dep., Sv res ombud v. världspovstkongr. i Madrid 20 o. Sthlm 24, ordf. i Gbgs borgerl. valmansföfb. 27-31, elektor, led. av Kristine förs. kyrkoråd, rev. i Gbgssystemet o. Gbgs Rest. A-B, stat. ombud v. rev. i vissa ensk. järnv., led. av riksd. första kamm. 41-42, suppl. i konstit :utsk., led. av första o. andra tillf. utsk. Föret, ett flertal resor på off. uppdr. t. uti. Skr. : art. i fackl. o. pO’Stala frågor. Hållit postala föredrag i Oslo o. Köpenh. m. fl. Pens. 47. KNO-2kl, KV02kl, KSpICOlkl, KAbess-SO, KBKrO, KDD02gr, EgvptNilO-3kl, RFrHL, RNS:t001kl, ’SerbS:t S04kl, GV:s PostJubM, ÖRKHt2kl u b, PRKM m b.
translated:
Oscar Viktor Emanuel, city treasurer, captain, Växjö, b. 1/12/97 in Örebro to wholesale merchant J. A. Pehrson and Augusta Johansson. Married on the 25th to Astrid Ruckman. — Graduate of Örebro Commercial Gymnasium in 1917, DS I (military rank) 1923. Captain in the Kronoberg Regiment. Assistant city treasurer in Örebro from 1919-1924, municipal treasurer in Borlänge from 1924-1930, city treasurer in Enköping from 1930-1938, and in Växjö from 1938. Supplementary chairman of the Enköping Systembolaget from 1935-1938, chairman of the Växjö Vocational Education Association from 1940, deputy chairman of the Kronoberg Vocational Education Association's executive committee from 1944, member of the Home Guard Administration from 1940, appointed member of the County Government Administration's Home Guard District, member of the Kronoberg Air Force Association's board (CFBSM), Kronoberg First Infantry Regiment's Sports Club (Kronob. Ist SM), VOR ftjt, Kronoberg Rifle Association (Kronob. bfb GM). 

Thore Gustaf Brynolf, postal director, Gothenburg, b. 9/11/81 in Leksand, Copperp. L., to postmaster Brynolf W. and Lydia Lindahl. Married in 1905 to Gärda Almqvist. Children: Herman, b. 1906, Bernt, b. 1910. - Postal exam in 1899, military exam (CO) 1902, preliminary law exam in the same year, court exam 1902. First postal examiner in 1909, notary in 1913, chief postal contractor in 1914, secretary of the General Postal Directorate since 1915, postal director and chief of the western postal district since 1917. Department secretary for the Parliamentary Review from 1907-1912, parliamentary appropriations committee from 1909-1912, member of the Postal Check Commission from 1918-1920, among other postal commissions, engaged for assignments within civil and financial departments, Swedish representative at the World Postal Congress in Madrid in 1920 and Stockholm in 1924, chairman of the Gothenburg Citizens' Electoral Committee from 1927-1931, elector, member of the Kristine Parish Church Council, auditor in the Gothenburg system and Gothenburg Restaurant AB, official representative at audits in certain private railways, member of the Parliament's First Chamber from 1941-1942, substitute in the constitutional committee, member of the first and second temporary committees. Undertook several official trips abroad. Written articles on specialized and postal matters. Retired in 1947. Recipient of the Royal Order of the Polar Star 2nd class, Royal Order of the Sword 2 nd class, Medal of the 12th Century's Jubilee of King Oscar II, Egyptian Nile Order 3rd class, Royal Swedish Heritage Protection Board's gold medal, Grand Officer of the Swedish Red Cross, Serbian White Eagle Order 4th class, Postal Jubilee Medal of the Royal Swedish Post, Royal Order of the Gold Cross of Estonia 2nd class with swords, Portuguese Order of Christ.
